page.title: 07LOCAL CRIME IN '85
page.content: A local widow, aged 76 years kept two robbers at bay when they recently broke into her flat.She threatened them with her bedside lamp and told them that her husband would soon be arriving home.The robbers wanted to know where she kept all her money but the 76 year old wonder woman would not tell them. Eventually the robbers left taking with them her handbag which contained Â£30 and some bank books. Both of the men wore jackets over their heads and broke in through the bathroom window. Another robbery in which Â£200 was stolen could have been carried out by the same robbers. This type of crime particularly involving older people appears to be coming more commonplace in the 1980's and there is growing concern about the increased use of violence against the elderly.
